Random Response Simulator


In a category learning study, some participants are bound to respond randomly instead of trying to learn the task. The degree to which a random responder's overall accuracy may differ from chance levels is dependent on the study design.

  • How many categories are being learned?
  • How many stimuli are presented during one block of learning?

My shiny app uses your responses to these questions to run Monte Carlo simulations which determine what levels of performance may be reasonably expected from a random responder.


Click here to access.
